amalgamation

noun
combination of companies into one
Pronunciation: / əˌmæl.ɡəˈmeɪ.ʃən / (AmE), / əˌmal.ɡəˈmeɪ.ʃən / (BrE)
the combining of two or more companies into one, especially to form a single larger company

Examples

amalgamation of companies
After a lengthy negotiation, the amalgamation was finally approved by both companies' boards.
Industry experts analyzed the effects of the recent amalgamation on consumer choice and pricing.
The amalgamation of the two banks created one of the largest financial institutions in the country.

Related Terms

  • synonym – merger: the joining together of two or more companies, organizations, or businesses into one
